$!You must tell DVLA if you have a brain tumour.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

## Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form B1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D[Download 'B1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 305KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066652.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

You need to speak with your doctor, who may advise you to [surrender your licence.](/driving-if-disabled/what-happens-after-you-tell-dvla "Surrendering your licence")

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: Ask your doctor about how a brain tumour might affect your driving - how to surrender your driving licence if your doctor advises
title: Brain tumour and driving
